head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Trenton: Corrections Chief Nominated

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Trenton: Corrections Chief Nominated

body.head.byline: By Laura Mansnerus (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: Gov James E McGreevey nominates Devon Brown to be commissioner of New Jersey Department of Corrections (S)

block.p: Gov. James E. McGreevey has made his last cabinet selection, nominating a corrections official from the District of Columbia as commissioner of the New Jersey Department of Corrections. The nominee, Devon Brown, 52, began his career in New Jersey, as a prison psychologist. He worked in Maryland later, becoming the head of the Montgomery County correction department before he was named deputy trustee of corrections, a federal post, in Washington. He also has a law degree.
